intro: Cordyline cheesemanii, commonly known as the Kauri cabbage, is a distinctive New Zealand plant with striking, sword-shaped leaves. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is native to the North Island of New Zealand. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, often forming dense clumps with a rosette of leaves. Its leaves are usually a deep green with a waxy texture and can reach lengths of up to 1.5 meters. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by red berries, which are an important food source for native birds.
